content.description: Thin slab to start. Reachy crux at the top.
content.location: 10' right of Cream filling, just left of the scrub oak bush.

content.description: Strenuous and sustained with a hard to read slopy finish to the anchor several feet over the top and not visible until you surmount the final overhang.
content.location: Left most route on the cliff.

content.description: Delicate technical climbing to a strenuous clip at the anchor.
content.location: Between creme filling and like mom used to make.

content.description: A bit runout in the middle (but the hard moves are directly above the bolt so not really that bad) and thin and technical in the crux at the top.

This is a fantastic pitch of vertical, technical climbing on creamy white rock. Big reaches between incut crimps leads to a difficult (to read and execute) top out on slopers.

 A worthy candidate for a rebolt.
content.protection:
4x bolts and a couple pieces. The bolts are of questionable integrity.

 More specifically:

 I'd recommend stick-clipping the first bolt. Blue and Green Aliens, or similar, in a horizontal protect some committing moves to the second bolt. A #6 BD Stopper (I think) could back up the third bolt.

 The anchor has no hardware for lowering (just bolts/hangers). I left a piece of my dog's leash and a single carabiner in January 2020, but I'd definitely bring something else if I did it again. Perhaps there is a walk-off?
content.location: The center route on the Twinkie.

content.description: Pumpy and technical. The warmup for the harder routes on the wall.
content.location: Starts beside the trimmed scrub oak.

content.description: 12+ Sustained technical climbing with a hard slopy finish to clip the anchor.
content.location: The far right most route on the wall. Just to the left of the arch.

content.description: Delicate slab to sustained and varied crimpers and slopers. A delicate crux half way and another getting to the anchor.
content.location: 2nd route from the right side of the cliff.

content.description: The Twinkie is a long, low, white buttress of rock that rises directly out of the east-west running gravely, limestone wash that is followed to Turtlehead Peak, The Trophy, etc. South facing, sunny, and warm, it is home to three short mixed routes. Pretty obscure but at least one of them (Like Mom Used to Make) is excellent and climbs way better than its uninspiring appearance.
